Claim: A web publication shared hundreds of times on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp in Nigeria claims the government will pay each citizen 8,500 naira ($23.60) monthly to encourage Nigerians to stay at home in a bid to slow down the spread of the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; officials have dismissed the claim, and the author of the viral publication admitted it was incorrect.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A web publication shared hundreds of times on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp in Nigeria claims the government will pay each citizen 8,500 naira ($23.60) monthly to encourage Nigerians to stay at home in a bid to slow down the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; officials have dismissed the claim, and the author of the viral publication admitted it was incorrect.

https://factcheck.afp.com/nigeria-not-paying-citizens-staying-home-amidst-coronavirus-pandemic

Claim: Gargling salt water can protect against against COVID-19 by washing down the virus into the gut.
Explaination: Gargling salt water is not a recommended protective measure against COVID-19, and has been debunked by the World Health Organization.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Gargling salt water can protect against against COVID-19 by washing down the virus into the gut.

Explanation:Gargling salt water is not a recommended protective measure against COVID-19, and has been debunked by the World Health Organization.

https://pesacheck.org/false-gargling-warm-water-with-salt-is-not-a-protective-measure-against-covid-19-cb6ed1e23654?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: Bill Gates and the Vatican have a plan to depopulate the world with a coronavirus vaccine.
Explaination: Video clip taken out of context from 2010 Gates TedTalk.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Bill Gates and the Vatican have a plan to depopulate the world with a coronavirus vaccine.

Explanation:Video clip taken out of context from 2010 Gates TedTalk.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472026-fact-check-no-plan-by-bill-gates-and-the-vatican-to-depopulate-world-with-coronavirus-vaccine-video-misinterprets-gates-speech.html

Claim: “While all COVID-19 news has been going on, the U.S. government has been sneakily trying to remove end-to-end encryption” which means “the government will be able to see all of your messages and listen to all of your calls.”
Explaination: A bill currently being considered by Congress, called the EARN IT Act, would make it easier for law enforcement to demand information from technology companies about certain users of their services. The bill wouldn't grant unlimited access. Any request would have to be premised on a link to suspected child exploitation.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “While all COVID-19 news has been going on, the U.S. government has been sneakily trying to remove end-to-end encryption” which means “the government will be able to see all of your messages and listen to all of your calls.”

Explanation:A bill currently being considered by Congress, called the EARN IT Act, would make it easier for law enforcement to demand information from technology companies about certain users of their services. The bill wouldn't grant unlimited access. Any request would have to be premised on a link to suspected child exploitation.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/09/instagram-posts/government-sneakily-trying-change-encryption-rules/

Claim: Photo shows dozens of wooden coffins of people dead from the coronavirus in Italy.
Explaination: Photo is of the coffins of African migrants who drowned off Italian island in 2013.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo shows dozens of wooden coffins of people dead from the coronavirus in Italy.

Explanation:Photo is of the coffins of African migrants who drowned off Italian island in 2013.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/photo-of-migrants-drowned-in-2013-not-italys-coronavirus-victims/

Claim: A screenshot of a purported news broadcast showing a lion in the street and reporting that Russia has deployed hundreds of lions to maintain order during the novel coronavirus lockdown has been shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter.
Explaination: The claim is false; the photo used in the image was taken in Johannesburg, South Africa in 2016; Russia has also not announced any major coronavirus lockdown.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A screenshot of a purported news broadcast showing a lion in the street and reporting that Russia has deployed hundreds of lions to maintain order during the novel coronavirus lockdown has been shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter.

Explanation:The claim is false; the photo used in the image was taken in Johannesburg, South Africa in 2016; Russia has also not announced any major coronavirus lockdown.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-was-taken-south-africa-2016-it-unrelated-coronavirus-pandemic

Claim: Second-hand clothes and blankets sold cheaply in African markets are infected with coronavirus.
Explaination: The photo is at least ten years old. China imports mostly new clothes to Africa, but WHO, Harvard Medical School and other experts advise it is safe to receive goods from COVID-19 affected areas.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Second-hand clothes and blankets sold cheaply in African markets are infected with coronavirus.

Explanation:The photo is at least ten years old. China imports mostly new clothes to Africa, but WHO, Harvard Medical School and other experts advise it is safe to receive goods from COVID-19 affected areas.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/no-photo-not-of-covid-19-infected-clothes-blankets-and-you-wont-get-the-virus-from-imported-goods/

Claim: Italians bidding goodbye to the world because of coronavirus.
Explaination: The video dates back to November 2019 and has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic. It is actually from an anti-fascist protest held in Italy.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Italians bidding goodbye to the world because of coronavirus.

Explanation:The video dates back to November 2019 and has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic. It is actually from an anti-fascist protest held in Italy.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/viral-video-of-italians-singing-bella-ciao-after-coronavirus-outbreak-fact-check

Claim: “All U.S. citizens are entitled to $700 USD per week to stay at home to avoid the spread of COVID-19 novel coronavirus, starting 3/17/20.”
Explaination: Americans could receive a check for $1,000 or more as part of an economic stimulus package amid the coronavirus. A Facebook post about weekly $700 checks is a hoax.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “All U.S. citizens are entitled to $700 USD per week to stay at home to avoid the spread of COVID-19 novel coronavirus, starting 3/17/20.”

Explanation:Americans could receive a check for $1,000 or more as part of an economic stimulus package amid the coronavirus. A Facebook post about weekly $700 checks is a hoax.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/18/facebook-posts/no-americans-arent-getting-700-weekly-checks-start/

Claim: The lockdown due to coronavirus has led to the reemergence of a large flock of birds at the riverfront in Ahmedabad.
Explaination: These birds are a regular site at the riverfront in Ahmedabad and the video has been shared with a false narrative.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The lockdown due to coronavirus has led to the reemergence of a large flock of birds at the riverfront in Ahmedabad.

Explanation:These birds are a regular site at the riverfront in Ahmedabad and the video has been shared with a false narrative.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/video-of-birds-flocking-in-ahmedabad-not-linked-to-covid-19-lockdown-7464

Claim: A bowl of freshly boiled garlic water can cure the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV)
Explaination: The World Health Organization (WHO) said that while eating garlic is healthy, it is not proven to protect humans against 2019-nCoV.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A bowl of freshly boiled garlic water can cure the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV)

Explanation:The World Health Organization (WHO) said that while eating garlic is healthy, it is not proven to protect humans against 2019-nCoV.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/251084-novel-coronavirus-can-be-cured-by-garlic

Claim: First policeman infected with coronavirus in Ecuador.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
html:
Claim: First policeman infected with coronavirus in Ecuador.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/ecuador-10-casos-positivos-para-coronavirus/?fbclid=IwAR1i-e5y3cPTG5WPJhuipV9cA_Ly5vPlz2dBTtczgID5peTbenUb7B8gCEg?check=3

Claim: President Donald Trump said, “People are dying who have never died before.”
Explaination: We searched a number of databases and found no evidence that Trump, on March 18, said, “People are dying who have never died before.”
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: President Donald Trump said, “People are dying who have never died before.”

Explanation:We searched a number of databases and found no evidence that Trump, on March 18, said, “People are dying who have never died before.”

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/19/facebook-posts/no-trump-didnt-say-people-are-dying-who-have-never/

Claim: A video shows Chinese police crackdown on suspected COVID-19 patients.
Explaination: We found the video to be False because this is an old video A from Hong Kong showing riot police storm a metro station to crack down on political protesters in the city.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows Chinese police crackdown on suspected COVID-19 patients.

Explanation:We found the video to be False because this is an old video A from Hong Kong showing riot police storm a metro station to crack down on political protesters in the city.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/chinese-police-crackdown-on-suspected-covid-19-patients/

Claim: The label on Dettol disinfectant spray claims it is proven to “kill coronavirus;” the company knew about the new strain since 2019.
Explaination: The recent outbreak of coronavirus in China is a strain named 2019-nCoV. For this particular strain, the source of infection, animal host and reservoir are currently unknown.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The label on Dettol disinfectant spray claims it is proven to “kill coronavirus;” the company knew about the new strain since 2019.

Explanation:The recent outbreak of coronavirus in China is a strain named 2019-nCoV. For this particular strain, the source of infection, animal host and reservoir are currently unknown.

http://newsmobile.in/articles/2020/02/06/did-dettol-know-about-the-new-novel-coronavirus-before-the-outbreak-heres-the-truth/

Claim: A video shows how the coronavirus is transmitted between people
Explaination: The claim is false; the video was produced by a regional hospital trust within the UK’s public healthcare system, the National Health Service (NHS), in May 2010 about how infections spread in hospitals.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows how the coronavirus is transmitted between people

Explanation:The claim is false; the video was produced by a regional hospital trust within the UK’s public healthcare system, the National Health Service (NHS), in May 2010 about how infections spread in hospitals.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-was-made-uk-public-hospital-trust-2010-about-infections-hospitals

Claim: The video shows Italians praying to get rid of the coronavirus.
Explaination: The video is from Peru and was shot in December 2017 ahead of Peru parliamentary elections.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The video shows Italians praying to get rid of the coronavirus.

Explanation:The video is from Peru and was shot in December 2017 ahead of Peru parliamentary elections.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-peru-election-viral-video-social-media-italy-corona-virus-1-1176213.html

Claim: Breathing steam from boiling citrus peels prevents and cures coronavirus.
Explaination: There is no way to increase your body temperature to kill the coronavirus, according to the WHO. Nigerian medical experts agreed that there was no evidence for the video's claims.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Breathing steam from boiling citrus peels prevents and cures coronavirus.

Explanation:There is no way to increase your body temperature to kill the coronavirus, according to the WHO. Nigerian medical experts agreed that there was no evidence for the video's claims.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/no-breathing-steam-from-boiling-orange-or-lemon-peels-doesnt-cure-or-prevent-coronavirus/

Claim: CEO Resignations Are Linked To Global Conspiracy.
Explaination: Some CEOs have stepped down since coronavirus outbreak, but there's not evidence to suggest it's all linked to a global power issue.
Label: False
html:
Claim: CEO Resignations Are Linked To Global Conspiracy.

Explanation:Some CEOs have stepped down since coronavirus outbreak, but there's not evidence to suggest it's all linked to a global power issue.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471921-fact-check-no-evidence-ceo-resignations-are-linked-to-global-conspiracy.html

Claim: Bats responsible for the outbreak of coronavirus originated from the rooftop of a house in Wuhan.
Explaination: The viral video is around nine years old and is from Miami, USA.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Bats responsible for the outbreak of coronavirus originated from the rooftop of a house in Wuhan.

Explanation:The viral video is around nine years old and is from Miami, USA.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-old-unrelated-video-of-bats-streaming-out-from-a-roof-linked-to-coronavirus-outbreak-1646095-2020-02-13

Claim: A woman infected with the coronavirus was killed by Chinese police.
Explaination: The woman in the viral video was taken into custody for violating traffic restrictions in China’s Heilongjiang province.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: A woman infected with the coronavirus was killed by Chinese police.

Explanation:The woman in the viral video was taken into custody for violating traffic restrictions in China’s Heilongjiang province.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-did-police-publicly-kill-coronavirus-infected-woman-in-china-1645123-2020-02-10

Claim: A video of food packets deposited on a street has been viewed millions of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows food donations for people in Turkey during a novel coronavirus lockdown.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video shows donations for victims of a deadly earthquake that struck eastern Turkey in January 2020, almost two months before Turkey recorded its first case of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video of food packets deposited on a street has been viewed millions of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows food donations for people in Turkey during a novel coronavirus lockdown.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video shows donations for victims of a deadly earthquake that struck eastern Turkey in January 2020, almost two months before Turkey recorded its first case of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-shows-donations-victims-deadly-earthquake-hit-eastern-turkey-january-2020?check=2

Claim: Dr. Vandana Tiwari, part of the team investigating and identifying attendees of Tablighi Jamaat in U.P’s Bareilly who were attacked by them succumbed to her injuries today
Explaination: Dr. Vandana Tiwari is actually from the Indian state of MP and she passed away due to brain hemorrhage and not was not part of any investigating team in Uttar Pradesh.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Dr. Vandana Tiwari, part of the team investigating and identifying attendees of Tablighi Jamaat in U.P’s Bareilly who were attacked by them succumbed to her injuries today

Explanation:Dr. Vandana Tiwari is actually from the Indian state of MP and she passed away due to brain hemorrhage and not was not part of any investigating team in Uttar Pradesh.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/death-of-a-doctor-in-mp-shared-with-a-communal-angle-amidst-covid-19/

Claim: Video of Wuhan market with dogs, snakes, rats and bats…
Explaination: Video taken in Indonesia (Langowan)
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Video of Wuhan market with dogs, snakes, rats and bats…

Explanation:Video taken in Indonesia (Langowan)

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200130-intox-chine-soupe-chauve-souris-rumeur-origine-coronavirus

Claim: A video has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook which claim it shows a woman who was detained by police in Australia after she tested positive for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, and was filmed spitting at a supermarket in a Sydney suburb.
Explaination: The claim is misleading; the video has been created from two clips of separate incidents involving different women; police in Australia said the first clip shows a woman who was questioned and released after a disturbance at a store in a Sydney suburb; the Australian supermarket chain cited in the misleading posts said the second clip was not filmed in its stores.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook which claim it shows a woman who was detained by police in Australia after she tested positive for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, and was filmed spitting at a supermarket in a Sydney suburb.

Explanation:The claim is misleading; the video has been created from two clips of separate incidents involving different women; police in Australia said the first clip shows a woman who was questioned and released after a disturbance at a store in a Sydney suburb; the Australian supermarket chain cited in the misleading posts said the second clip was not filmed in its stores.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-shows-two-separate-incidents-involving-different-women-supermarkets

Claim: Ukrainian media registred the first confirmed case of the new coronavirus.
Explaination: We have described that this is not the case and indicated that there are several strains.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Ukrainian media registred the first confirmed case of the new coronavirus.

Explanation:We have described that this is not the case and indicated that there are several strains.

https://www.facebook.com/VoxCheck/photos/a.258957094435803/1124831327848371/?type=3&av=253424198322426&eav=AfaTFvD4WI9Wnk5V_K1aqX0EIuo7TnDQPoakZrjDkmPrlX2ogbfhagnEQJhJrnVJ0iw&theater

Claim: “So let me get this straight about this virus. It’s “new” yet it was lab created and patented in 2015 (in development since 03’).”
Explaination: All of the posts link to patents that are related to two different viruses in the coronavirus family. There is no patent related to the new virus
Label: (Org. doesn't apply rating)
html:
Claim: “So let me get this straight about this virus. It’s “new” yet it was lab created and patented in 2015 (in development since 03’).”

Explanation:All of the posts link to patents that are related to two different viruses in the coronavirus family. There is no patent related to the new virus

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/01/social-media-posts-spread-bogus-coronavirus-conspiracy-theory/

Claim: Hospitals are advising people to wear gloves at petrol pumps.
Explaination: The hospital named in the message confirmed that it did not issue this advice, and health authorities, including the Chief Medical Officer, said that the public is not being advised to do this.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Hospitals are advising people to wear gloves at petrol pumps.

Explanation:The hospital named in the message confirmed that it did not issue this advice, and health authorities, including the Chief Medical Officer, said that the public is not being advised to do this.

https://jrnl.ie/5052956

Claim: A WhatsApp forward, along with a video, is doing the rounds in which it is claimed that a person who belongs to the Tablighi Jamaat was kept in an isolation ward where he started wandering naked. The viral forward also claims that the person who was wandering naked did this vulgar act intentionally.
Explaination: The video being circulated in the name of Tablighi Jamaat members’ misbehaving with the nurses treating them for the COVID-19 is old. Hence it is evident that the viral claim is ‘False’ and is being shared with a communal angle.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: A WhatsApp forward, along with a video, is doing the rounds in which it is claimed that a person who belongs to the Tablighi Jamaat was kept in an isolation ward where he started wandering naked. The viral forward also claims that the person who was wandering naked did this vulgar act intentionally.

Explanation:The video being circulated in the name of Tablighi Jamaat members’ misbehaving with the nurses treating them for the COVID-19 is old. Hence it is evident that the viral claim is ‘False’ and is being shared with a communal angle.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15610172

Claim: Actor Daniel Radcliffe tested positive for covid-19.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: FALSE
html:

Explaination: This is an incident when a bank was looted in Venezuelan city of Mérida and old money notes had been scattered on the streets.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Italians throwing money on streets amid COVID-19 crisis.

Explanation:This is an incident when a bank was looted in Venezuelan city of Mérida and old money notes had been scattered on the streets.

Claim: There are 59 positive coronavirus cases in Nagpur along with three doctors, one of whom is on ventilator.
Explaination: There are 5 coronavirus cases in Nagpur as of March 26. None of them is a doctor.
Label: False
html:

Explanation:There are 5 coronavirus cases in Nagpur as of March 26. None of them is a doctor.

Claim: Racist scene against Chinese people in the metro in Belgium.
Explaination: Vidéo is an excerpt of the Youtube channel "Would you react" with actors.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Racist scene against Chinese people in the metro in Belgium.

Explanation:Vidéo is an excerpt of the Youtube channel "Would you react" with actors.

Claim: A list of 10 claims about the coronavirus, allegedly from a doctor who worked in a hospital in Shenzhen.
Explaination: Most of the claims in the message are false and many are misleading. Drinking warm water will not protect you from getting the coronavirus, for example, and there is no evidence that the virus is killed by a temperature of 26/27 degrees either.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A list of 10 claims about the coronavirus, allegedly from a doctor who worked in a hospital in Shenzhen.

Explanation:Most of the claims in the message are false and many are misleading. Drinking warm water will not protect you from getting the coronavirus, for example, and there is no evidence that the virus is killed by a temperature of 26/27 degrees either.

https://www.thejournal.ie/debunked-coronavirus-whatsapp-5059709-Mar2020/

Explanation:The picture is indeed from Italy but is seven years old and has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak.

Claim: Taking a hot bath, breathing in hot steam or using a hand dryer to blow hot air up the nose are effective ways to prevent COVID-19, according to a lecturer in health sciences faculty at Ghanaian university.
Explaination: No evidence for claims, which go counter to WHO recommendations.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Taking a hot bath, breathing in hot steam or using a hand dryer to blow hot air up the nose are effective ways to prevent COVID-19, according to a lecturer in health sciences faculty at Ghanaian university.

Explanation:No evidence for claims, which go counter to WHO recommendations.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/hot-baths-hot-hand-dryers-and-other-heat-will-not-kill-coronavirus/

Claim: Posts on social media claim there is a US patent for the novel coronavirus and a European patent for a vaccine, citing specific patent numbers.
Explaination: This is false; the US number relates to an application about a different coronavirus, and the European number is for a patent aimed at a disease that afflicts poultry.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Posts on social media claim there is a US patent for the novel coronavirus and a European patent for a vaccine, citing specific patent numbers.

Explanation:This is false; the US number relates to an application about a different coronavirus, and the European number is for a patent aimed at a disease that afflicts poultry.

https://factcheck.afp.com/false-claims-patents-fuel-novel-coronavirus-conspiracy-theories-online
ann21_remarks: Also relates to virus origins and vaccines

Claim: President Trump did sign a 5G bill but exposure effects are misleading.
Explaination: No clear evidence that exposure of 5G at the current recommended levels are harmful long term.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Trump did sign a 5G bill but exposure effects are misleading.

Explanation:No clear evidence that exposure of 5G at the current recommended levels are harmful long term.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/Fact-Check-Trump-DID-Sign-5G-Bill-But-Exposure-Effects-Are-Misleading.html

Claim: The Department of Health (DOH) reports fake cigarettes that spread coronavirus have reached the Philippines.
Explaination: The DOH did not issue any advisory on the transmission of the coronavirus through fake cigarettes or that they have reached the Philippines.
Label: False

Explanation:The DOH did not issue any advisory on the transmission of the coronavirus through fake cigarettes or that they have reached the Philippines.

Claim: Trump’s claim that he imposed the first travel ban on China.
Explaination: Nearly 40 countries imposed restrictions earlier than the USA but USA was one of the first large economic powers to do so.
Label: Three Pinocchios
html:
Claim: Trump’s claim that he imposed the first travel ban on China.

Explanation:Nearly 40 countries imposed restrictions earlier than the USA but USA was one of the first large economic powers to do so.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/04/07/trumps-claim-that-he-imposed-first-china-ban/

Claim: Lysol disinfectant label says it’s tested against the new coronavirus.
Explaination: Covs a a family of viruses.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Lysol disinfectant label says it’s tested against the new coronavirus.

Explanation:Covs a a family of viruses.

https://factcheck.afp.com/lysol-product-labels-are-not-evidence-novel-coronavirus-conspiracy

Claim: Photo purportedly showing Tom Hanks holding a volleyball, claiming the hospital staff in Australia gave it to him as a tribute and to cheer him up while in quarantine.
Explaination: The image has been doctored using a 2015 photograph of Hanks and a stock photo of a hospital ward; the doctored photo emerged on a satirical website.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo purportedly showing Tom Hanks holding a volleyball, claiming the hospital staff in Australia gave it to him as a tribute and to cheer him up while in quarantine.

Explanation:The image has been doctored using a 2015 photograph of Hanks and a stock photo of a hospital ward; the doctored photo emerged on a satirical website.

https://factcheck.afp.com/doctored-image-contains-2015-photo-tom-hanks-and-ball-movie-cast-away

Claim: An Image is being shared on social media claiming; this italian doctor couple in the picture worked day and night and saved the lives of 134 patients, but on the eighth day, they caught coronavirus and died after an hour.
Explaination: The couple in the picture is not Italian but a couple from Spain. The photograph was taken at Barcelona Airport on March 12, 2020.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: An Image is being shared on social media claiming; this italian doctor couple in the picture worked day and night and saved the lives of 134 patients, but on the eighth day, they caught coronavirus and died after an hour.

Explanation:The couple in the picture is not Italian but a couple from Spain. The photograph was taken at Barcelona Airport on March 12, 2020.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15350708

Claim: A new vaccine that can cure COVID-19 patients in 3 hours is now ready.
Explaination: As of March 27, there is still no vaccine or drug approved by the World Health Organization (WHO) or any Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in the world to cure or prevent COVID-19. Moreover, the image used in the post is not a photo of vaccines from Roche Medical Company, but is a photo of rapid test kits from South Korean company Sugentech.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A new vaccine that can cure COVID-19 patients in 3 hours is now ready.

Explanation:As of March 27, there is still no vaccine or drug approved by the World Health Organization (WHO) or any Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in the world to cure or prevent COVID-19. Moreover, the image used in the post is not a photo of vaccines from Roche Medical Company, but is a photo of rapid test kits from South Korean company Sugentech.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/256069-coronavirus-vaccine-ready-cure-within-hours

Claim: Photograph of a rail track from Colombo filled with wild-flowers during current curfew period in Sri Lanka.
Explaination: Stock image of wild flowers from a Texas rail track interpreted as scenes from a Sri Lankan rail track during curfew period.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Photograph of a rail track from Colombo filled with wild-flowers during current curfew period in Sri Lanka.

Explanation:Stock image of wild flowers from a Texas rail track interpreted as scenes from a Sri Lankan rail track during curfew period.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/10/fact-check-false-image-of-sri-lankan-rail-tracks/

Claim: False COVID-19 hotline number shared in Canada.
Explaination: 811 is not an official public health hotline in Ontario, and the provincial ministry of health is not organizing home visits, a spokeswoman told AFP.
Label: False
html:
